title: Pablo-wood
author: Pablo-wood
content: please I will need guidance on how to get started with freelancing but will prefer if there are crypto based specifically Bitcoin as main payment option. I am a complete novice as regards freelancing and will like to know how best to set up a catchy profile that will be outstanding and unique one that will make my skills more marketable.

comments.author: un_rank
comments.body: You first of all need to identify the unique skills you offer, this is the first step of freelancing; offering marketable and practical skills.I am not an expert in marketing freelancing skills but you should focus on what platforms are best to market your skills and which ones fit your desire to be paid in crypto specifically. Then you build your pitch around that platform and the tools available to you there.Your pitch or ad regardless of the platform you post it in should be;CatchyProfessionalUniqueSelf explanatoryShould show your best angleIt should also be updated and not just reused over and over againYou can include banners or info-graphics if the platform you are marketing on allows it and it should also be done very professionally.This forum is a good place to get clients, specifically those willing to pay in Bitcoin. Head over to the Services[1] section and create a thread, but first look at other service threads and how they sell their skills to learn from others.You need to become at least a Jr. Member or purchase Copper membership[2] to post images here on the forum.You have a limited time to catch the eye of a potential client among thousands of other equally qualified ones and you should ensure your pitch gets their attention and holds it.Try to watch videos about marketing your skills and work using that to build yourself.[1] https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?board=52.0[2] https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?action=credit;promote- Jay -

comments.author: BitcoinPanther
comments.body: You can check this freelancing sites that gives freelancers a chance to get paid in cryptocurrency:https://www.linkedin.com/pulse/check-out-5-freelancing-websites-pay-cryptocurrency-plomxtechThe site state the following platform that accept freelancing with crypto payment:Blocklancer ► dedicated to ETH paymentLaborX ► dedicated to ETH paymentCrypto jobs ► pays in cryptocurrencyPompCryptoJobs ► pays in cryptocurrencyThis site article about freelancing platform that pays in Bitcoin: https://www.webemployed.com/freelance-websites-pay-bitcoin/The article list the following:CryptoGrindQuoteCryptoGrind is a platform for freelancers to earn bitcoins through a multitude of tasks or jobs. You can find jobs ranging from content writing to software development. To start earning, all you have to do is create your profile, advertise your skills and wait for employers who are looking for workers like you.Cryptogrind offers its employers and freelancers Multi-signature bitcoin escrow system for transactions. No need to get in to technicalities. You should just know that this is a completely secure way of doing transactions online.BitGigsQuoteBitGigs is an online jobs board where hundreds of freelance jobs are posted regularly. Most of these jobs are remote, so you can apply from anywhere. The jobs are mostly related to technical writing, content writing and software development. So if you’ve got technical skills under your belt, you can earn tons of cash with this platform.They also give you the option to sell your services to clients. Creating a gig is very easy and your offering will be up and running in no time.Earn.comQuoteEarn.com is an online Short tasks based platform. You can earn your coins by replying to emails and completing any tasks that you get via their online portal.You can even earn your bitcoins by watching bitcoin tutorials on the website. Simply create your profile on the site and fill out the registration forms. Once it’s done, you become a member on the website. Depending on the recruiters and employers, you start getting paid messages through which you earn your bitcoin by replying to them.CryptoJobsQuoteCryptoJobs is a blockchain based job platform. It allows users to post jobs and get the right employees. CryptoJobs allows you to take up jobs in different fields ranging from sales and marketing to development.While some jobs require you to work in a specific country, most of the jobs posted there are remote. Which means you can apply and earn in any country. A good number of jobs are posted everyday so you should always lookout for related opportunities.

comments.author: SamReomo
comments.body: Quote from: Pablo-wood on August 25, 2023, 06:17:44 PMplease I will need guidance on how to get started with freelancing but will prefer if there are crypto based specifically Bitcoin as main payment option. I am a complete novice as regards freelancing and will like to know how best to set up a catchy profile that will be outstanding and unique one that will make my skills more marketable.If you want to get started in the world of freelancing then first you'll have to learn some skills and master them at professional level. A freelancer always needs to have mastery over the skills that they are going to offer as freelancing services. I'm not sure about any such sites where freelancers get paid using Bitcoin, but only this forum is a place where freelancers can get paid using Bitcoin if they offer their freelancing services in services board of the forum. I would not consider this forum as a freelancing site because it has many threads which aren't related to freelancing at all and that's a solid reason for not calling it as a freelancing site.If you're very new in freelancing then first you need to learn about it and the best place to learn about freelancing is YouTube of course because many creators have already published great videos related to freelancing and those videos can be helpful for someone like you who is totally new to the field. I would also recommend you to read some books related to freelancing as those books will explain in depth that how a new freelancer should set-up his/her profile and how to make a best portfolio over time. I would recommend you to learn a skill from the basics and master it to the advanced levels and once you get confidence that you have completely mastered the skills then you should try to offer your services for free in order to get some rock solid review which would help you to gain more clients later on. The free offer will let others see that how good you're at that particular skill and you'll also get some public dealing experience by delivering those free services. The journey is a long one and you must have to do your best to be up to date with the skill that you have mastered because the competition is very tough at freelancing sites and only the ones will get clients who offer best service to the clients.
